description: Returns the log events of a container of your Amazon Lightsail container service. If your container service has more than one node (i.e., a scale greater than 1), then the log events that are returned for the specified container are merged from all nodes on your container service.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the container service for which to get a container log.

parameters.name: containerName
parameters.description: The name of the container that is either running or previously ran on the container service for which to return a log.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: The start of the time interval for which to get log data. Constraints: Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Specified in the Unix time format. For example, if you wish to use a start time of October 1, 2018, at 8 PM UTC, specify 1538424000 as the start time. You can convert a human-friendly time to Unix time format using a converter like Epoch converter.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: The end of the time interval for which to get log data. Constraints: Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Specified in the Unix time format. For example, if you wish to use an end time of October 1, 2018, at 9 PM UTC, specify 1538427600 as the end time. You can convert a human-friendly time to Unix time format using a converter like Epoch converter.

parameters.name: filterPattern
parameters.description: The pattern to use to filter the returned log events to a specific term. The following are a few examples of filter patterns that you can specify: To return all log events, specify a filter pattern of "". To exclude log events that contain the ERROR term, and return all other log events, specify a filter pattern of "-ERROR". To return log events that contain the ERROR term, specify a filter pattern of "ERROR". To return log events that contain both the ERROR and Exception terms, specify a filter pattern of "ERROR Exception". To return log events that contain the ERROR or the Exception term, specify a filter pattern of "?ERROR ?Exception".

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: The token to advance to the next page of results from your request. To get a page token, perform an initial GetContainerLog request. If your results are paginated, the response will return a next page token that you can specify as the page token in a subsequent request.

nested_items.name: logEvents
nested_items.description: An array of objects that describe the log events of a container.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the container service log event was created.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: The message of the container service log event.

nested_items.name: nextPageToken
nested_items.description: The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
